site_name: The Bilton Centre, Metropolitan Police Car Pound V R E S Office
description: Replacement of existing fencing, topping and pedestrian gates.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:
Perivale Vres Car Pound Site Plan, Drawing No. 5217988-ATK-XX-DR-BS-5000, Rev. P1, dated 8 June 2023
Perivale Vres Car Pound Proposed Fence, Drawing No. 5217988-ATK-SCL-PR-DE-A-5001, Rev. P2, dated 8 June 2023
Perivale Vres Car Pound Boundary Existing Fence Detail, Drawing No. 5217988-ATK-XX-DR-BS-5002, Rev. P1, dated 31 August 2023
Perivale Vres Car Pound Boundary Fence Detail 1 of 2, Drawing No. 5217988-ATK-XX-DR-BS-5003, Rev. P1, dated 31 August 2023
Perivale Vres Car Pound Boundary Fence Detail 2 of 2, Drawing No. 5217988-ATK-XX-DR-BS-5004, Rev. P1, dated 31 August 2023
Arboriculturalist's Report, prepared by BHA Trees Ltd, dated December 2023
Planning Statement, prepared by Knight Frank, dated 31 March 2024
Securus S3, Drawing No. CLD-3408-1, Rev. 1, dated 7 March 2023
Securus S3, Drawing No. CLD-3408-2, Rev. 1, dated 7 March 2023
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the Arboriculturalist's Report, prepared by BHA Trees Ltd, dated December 2023.
Reason: To ensure the ten trees along the north side of the site that are subject to Tree Preservation Orders (TPOs) are protected during construction.
